intro: Amomum subcapitatum, commonly known as the small-headed cardamom, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into oval, dark brown fruits. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Amomum subcapitatum is typically grown for its aromatic seeds and medicinal value in its native region.
